intro: Cyrtandra heintzelmaniana, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its restricted range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
